result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justice D. Robison

records.addlTxt: Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and order for dismissal

3:16 PM Defendant Justice D. Robison in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Justice D. Robison. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. No Contest plea entered on Count #1, #2, #3 and #4. The Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1, #2, #3 and #4.The Court accepts the deferred prosecution agreement for count #1. The Court with holds sentence on count #2, 3 and 4. Count #5 to be dismissed and read in. Defendant advised of voting rights if convicted of a felony. Defendant advised of firearm restriction if convicted of a felony. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of post conviction relief. Defendant to report to probation today. The Court orders Court costs be remitted on count 3 and 4 as well as domestic abuse surcharge to be waived on count 4.

11:24 AM Defendant Justice D. Robison in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Justice D. Robison.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:35 PM Justice D. Robison, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Andrew J. Burdick. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Correct information has been filed.   Defendant waives formal reading of information.   Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. No substitution requested. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:01 PM Justice D. Robison, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Andrew J. Burdick. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. A.R.A is also present in the court room. Officer Taylor Heiman sworn on oath & testifies under direct and cross. Witness identifies the defendant. Attorney Kohl gives Officer Heiman complaint to review. No objection from defense. Witness excused. Defense objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Court advises defendant of charges & penalties.  Attorney Kohl will take 30 days to file information. Matter set over.  Arraignment scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
